nodes.name: Sticky Note

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
## Let GPT do the heavy work

For the prompt we follow the one-shot'ish principle. Also I've decided to **_NOT_** give the AI the personal data. Keeps it simpler regarding data privacy.

The AI-Chain will generate a **Headline** and the **Text** for the Email and even **decides** if we should send the user a **Coupon**.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note3

parameters.content:
## Make sure we have what we need
We do not want to sent empty messages to our customers

nodes.name: Sticky Note5

parameters.content:
## Mocked: Fake a Coupon Code
For a real life scenario add the automated coupon generation here

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note6

parameters.content:
# Documentation

This Workflow is for the n8n AI / Langchain Competition.

It solves the Problem: Personalizing marketing emails based on customer purchase history.

I've found it a bit ambiguous and decided to go the "Convert unhappy customers with a Coupon"-Route.

So this workflow utilizes the new LangChain Node for generating personalized E-Mail campaigns and decide if the user might need a coupon to be satisfied. Classic Rebound stuff. 

There is also a Node "Some Options..." which can be adjusted to quickly change the direction this Campaign should go.

Additionally we use n8n to generate the HTML Mails by two different Templates. One with simple text and another for that Coupon handling.

![Image]({{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}
Enjoy the Workflow! ❤️ 
{{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Sticky Note7

parameters.content:
## Send the Email to the Customer

Although it's cool that n8n allows sending emails via SMPT I would recommend to stick to your newsletter tool for that to keep track of opt-outs and stuff.

nodes.notes: This stickyNote node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Extract from File
nodes.notes: This extractFromFile node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Some Options for the Campaign

assignments.name: Flavour
assignments.value: be friendly and witty but also cool and direct. Critique is valuable and embrace the feedback.

nodes.notes: This set node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Information Extractor

options.systemPromptTemplate:
=Determine the sentiment of the given product feedback. Then generate a Headline and Text without salutation or any greeting for a personalized Email Campagin after a User gave a product review. If the user seems not happy, tell them that you have a Coupon for them. The User finds the Coupon Code below this E-mail. 
The target of the campagin: {{ $json['Campaign Target'] }}.
Remember: {{ $json['Flavour'] }}. Avoid any greeting.

nodes.notes: This informationExtractor node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: AI did fail us1
nodes.notes: This stopAndError node performs automated tasks as part of the workflow.

nodes.name: Fake coupon

assignments.name: Coupon Terms
assignments.value: =Valid until {{ $today.plus({days: 14}).format("d. MMM. y") }} | minimum purchase amount: 20$

Here's a Coupon for you!

{{ $json['Coupon'] }}

{{ $json['Coupon Terms'] }}

Definitely not a real company Lmt.
Also not a real street 123
Unreal Town

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Manualtrigger Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Manualtrigger Workflow. This workflow integrates 12 different services: stickyNote, httpRequest, merge, informationExtractor, set. It contains 28 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 28
- **Node Types**: 12
- **Error Handling**: ✅ Implemented
- **Security**: ✅ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ✅ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **When clicking "Execute Workflow"**: manualTrigger
- **Sticky Note**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note2**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note3**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note4**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note5**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note6**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note7**: stickyNote
- **Extract from File**: extractFromFile
- ... and 18 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
